original: Cahp, Carl Viktor P :son, direktör, Norrköping, f. 4/6/89 i Vara, Skarab. 1., av dir. C. A. Pettersson o. Mathilda Andersson. G. 17 m. Karin Swärd. Barn: Dagmar f. 18, Ingrid 25, Gunnar 28. — Lärov:stud. i Norrköp., han-,delssk. i Berlin, praktik i textil- o. konf:ind. i Tyskl. 06-07, Engl. 11. Inträdde i A-B C. A. Pettersson i Norrköp. 05, bol. verkst. dir. sed. 22. Styr :-led. i IFK Norrköp. flera år, ordf. i östergötl. fotb :förb. tjugo år. På sin tid främst, idr :man, bl. a. distr :mäst. f. östergötl. i fotb., bandy, kulstötn., diskus, löpn. 100 m. samt stafettlöpn. åren omkr. 09, indiv. måst. i Norrköp. curlingklubb, lagsegr. 23. Inneh. ett S’tort antal idroltsl. utm:- o. förtj :-tecken.
translated: Cahp, Carl Viktor P:son, director, Norrköping, born on June 4, 1889 in Vara, Skaraborg County, son of director C.A. Pettersson and Mathilda Andersson. Married to Karin Swärd in 1917, with three children: Dagmar (born in 1918), Ingrid (born in 1925), and Gunnar (born in 1928). He studied at a secondary school in Norrköping and a commerce school in Berlin, and completed an internship in textile and clothing industry in Germany in 1906-1907 and in England in 1911. He started working at A-B C. A. Pettersson in Norrköping in 1905, became a board member in 1922, and executive director of the company thereafter. He served as a board member of several years at IFK Norrköping, and as chairman of the football association of Östergötland for twenty years. He was a skilled athlete, among other things, he became the district champion in Östergötland in football, bandy, shot put, discus, 100m run, and relay races around 1909, the individual champion of Norrköping's Curling Club, as well as member of the winning team in 1923. He received a large number of sports medals and awards.

awards.name: Individual Champion of Norrköping's Curling Club
Member of the Winning Team in 1923
